explanation:
OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET - Macro used to obtain 'impl'; its expansion may contain function calls (e.g. index lookup) that could introduce a call back to the target, so the macro definition must be inspected for indirect recursion.
OS_ObjectIndexFromToken - Shown as a callee in the static call graph; must be checked to ensure it does not (directly or indirectly) call OS_MutSemTake_Impl or OS_MutSemTake, which would create indirect recursion.
pthread_mutex_lock - A direct callee in the function body; verify it does not call back into application code (unlikely but must be confirmed) or otherwise lead to a path that returns to OS_MutSemTake_Impl.
OS_MutSemTake - The non-Impl wrapper/caller of OS_MutSemTake_Impl; if any callee of OS_MutSemTake_Impl can reach OS_MutSemTake, that would form an indirect recursion (Impl -> ... -> MutSemTake -> Impl), so its behavior must be checked.
OS_impl_mutex_table - The table passed to OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET; the table implementation or helper functions referenced by it could include calls that lead back to OS_MutSemTake_Impl, so inspect this symbol/data and any accessors it uses.
